ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in American Studies

Requirements: A completed application for admission through the Common Application or the WNE Application. Official high school transcript(s) sent directly from your school. One letter of recommendation (from a teacher or school counselor).
Description: Our Bachelor of Arts in Communication program provides a foundation in the theory and practice of human communication. The Communication program at Western New England University encourages students to think critically, communicate clearly and effectively, conduct research, and adapt to diverse communication situations. Our liberal arts approach allows students to explore areas of interest and customize their degree program to meet their career goals. Our students gain hands-on experience and build professional portfolios, so they are prepared to make an impact in a variety of fields, from journalism to public relations to social media management. Our program places a premium on communication ethics and diversity and fosters a deeper understanding of human behavior.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Creative Writing
Requirements: To apply, first-year students must submit a completed Common Application or Western New England University Application and official high school transcript(s). A personal essay/writing sample is required for the Common Application. Western New England University is a test-optional institution, and students may choose whether or not to submit SAT or ACT scores. Letters of recommendation are an optional component of the application for admission to the Creative Writing major.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Creative Writing will engage you in the art and craft of poetry, fiction, nonfiction, and dramatic writing. This program will equip you with a strong foundation in literary studies and theory, while helping you to develop your individual voice. You will learn the history, theory, and practice of literary criticism, and develop skills in writing, editing, and publishing. The program culminates in a senior capstone project, allowing you to showcase your best creative work.

Economics majors gain a fundamental understanding of economic theory with a strong foundation in microeconomics, macroeconomics, and econometrics. In addition, you will learn to apply economic theory to policy decisions in both the public and private sectors. With opportunities for internships, study abroad, and participation in the University’s Investment Club, you’ll be prepared to pursue careers in the financial and insurance industries, as a policy analyst in the public sector, or continue on to graduate school.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Elementary Education
Requirements:
First-year applicants must submit the following credentials:

- A completed Common Application or Western New England University Application
- Official high school transcript
- One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor
- Essay or personal statement
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Elementary Education is a four-year program that prepares students for initial licensure in Massachusetts to teach grades 1–6. Our program combines a strong liberal arts foundation with professional pedagogical coursework, and extensive field experiences that begin in your first year. We emphasize a student-centered, reflective, and inclusive approach to teaching and learning to meet the needs of diverse learners in elementary school settings. In this program, students will learn: Child development and learning theories, Curriculum design and assessment strategies, Inclusive practices for diverse learners, Effective classroom management techniques, and Subject-specific pedagogy (literacy, mathematics, science, social studies, and the arts). The program also includes fieldwork, student teaching, and professional development opportunities in various school settings, including public, private, and charter schools.

Requirements: All first-year applicants must submit the following: Completed Common Application or the Western New England University Application, Official high school transcript, One letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher, Personal Essay. Western New England University is a test-optional institution, meaning you are not required to submit SAT or ACT scores to be considered for admission.
Description: English majors at Western New England University develop critical thinking skills, hone their writing abilities across a variety of genres, deepen their understanding of literary and cultural traditions, and expand their knowledge of the English language. You will explore the literary tradition and the richness of the English language itself. As an English major, you’ll join a vibrant academic community and learn how to analyze, interpret, and communicate your ideas effectively and persuasively, both orally and in writing. You’ll be prepared for careers that require strong communication skills and an ability to analyze complex information. Our program will help you develop the transferable critical thinking and communication skills necessary for success across a wide range of fields, including education, law, journalism, communications, public relations, publishing, government, and business.

As a student in the Bachelor of Arts in History program at Western New England University, you will explore the past, develop strong analytical and research skills, and learn to communicate effectively. Our curriculum emphasizes critical thinking, historical analysis, and the ability to interpret complex information. You’ll study a broad range of historical periods and regions, from ancient civilizations to modern global events. Our dedicated faculty will guide you through in-depth discussions, primary source analysis, and research projects that will prepare you for a variety of careers or further graduate studies. Beyond the classroom, opportunities for internships, study abroad, and participation in historical societies enhance your learning experience. A degree in History from WNE provides a versatile skill set applicable to fields such as law, education, journalism, public service, and archives.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Integrated Studies
Requirements:
To apply for first-year admission, the following items are required:
- Common Application
- Official High School Transcript
- One Letter of Recommendation: From your school counselor or a teacher in a core academic subject area (English, Math, Science, History, or Foreign Language).
- Standardized Test Scores (SAT or ACT): Western New England University is test optional for most academic programs.
- Personal Essay: Included in the Common Application.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in International Studies
Description: Global perspective and cultural understanding are essential for success in today’s interconnected world. Western New England University’s Bachelor of Arts in International Studies program provides you with an interdisciplinary understanding of global issues and prepares you for a career in a globally focused field. Develop a global mindset and critical thinking skills as you explore diverse cultures, political systems, and economic realities. Our interdisciplinary curriculum will expose you to various perspectives, preparing you to tackle complex global challenges in a wide range of careers including diplomacy, international business, and non-profit work. As an International Studies major, you will take courses that span political, economic, historical, and cultural perspectives of the world. Students choose from a wide variety of courses in disciplines like history, political science, economics, and foreign languages. You will explore global issues, such as international relations, human rights, environmental sustainability, and economic development, gaining a deep understanding of the complexities of our interconnected world.

Requirements: Application requirements for first-year students include a completed Common Application, official high school transcript(s), one letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor, and an essay or personal statement. Western New England University is a test-optional institution, meaning students may choose whether to submit SAT or ACT scores for admission consideration.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Studies
Description:
A Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Studies at the University of Delaware allows you to build a multidisciplinary program from diverse academic areas. You'll work closely with an advisor to custom-design a major that meets your specific interests and goals.
The Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Liberal Studies allows students to create an individualized and interdisciplinary major that combines courses from a variety of academic areas and leads to a degree from the College of Arts and Sciences. Students work closely with an academic advisor to design a program of study tailored to their specific interests and goals that is based on the requirements for the BA in Liberal Studies degree.
The program promotes critical thinking, communication, problem-solving, and appreciation for the complexities of an interdependent world. It prepares students for a variety of careers in fields such as business, communications, human services, and public administration, as well as for graduate study in professional and academic disciplines.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Political Science
Description: A Bachelor of Arts in Political Science program at WNE focuses on the dynamics of government, public policies, political ideas, and the exercise of power both in the United States and abroad. Political science provides an excellent background for careers in politics, law, journalism, foreign service, law enforcement, teaching, and business. With a solid foundation in political theory, American government, international relations, and comparative politics, you will also gain critical thinking, analytical, and communication skills necessary to pursue a wide range of graduate and professional studies. In this program, you will develop the analytical skills to assess the challenges facing our society as well as an understanding of the solutions for pressing issues at home and abroad. With a broad knowledge base in political science, you'll be well-prepared to make a difference in our world.

Requirements: To apply as a first-year student, you will need to submit a completed application (either the Western New England Application or the Common Application), your official high school transcript, one letter of recommendation, and an essay or personal statement. Western New England University is Test-Optional, so submitting SAT/ACT scores is not required.
Description: Psychology at Western New England University offers a strong foundation in the field through a variety of courses that span the major areas of psychology, including human development, social behavior, biological psychology, abnormal psychology, and experimental psychology. Our small classes and active learning environment give you the opportunity to work closely with faculty mentors, helping you to develop critical thinking, communication, and research skills valuable in a variety of careers and graduate studies. The major emphasizes scientific methodology, psychological assessment, and data analysis as well as the application of ethical principles in professional settings. You can further customize your degree through elective courses, internships, and research opportunities, preparing you for a diverse range of career paths or advanced studies in areas such as clinical psychology, counseling, social work, school psychology, industrial/organizational psychology, and more.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Secondary Education in English
Requirements:
To be considered for admission, you must submit the following:

A completed application for admission through the Common Application or the WNE Application.
An official high school transcript.
One letter of recommendation from your school counselor or a teacher.
A personal essay or writing sample.
An official report of scores on the SAT or the ACT (optional).
Description: Our undergraduate programs lead to a Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Education, designed to provide future educators with the theoretical knowledge, practical experience, and technological expertise needed to meet the diverse needs of today's learners. Our programs prepare you to become a skilled and compassionate teacher who can make a real difference in students' lives. You will gain a deep understanding of educational theories, child development, and effective teaching methodologies, along with hands-on experience in diverse classroom settings. Small class sizes and access to the latest educational technology will prepare you for a successful career as an educator. Our Secondary Education (8–12) program specifically offers concentrations in Biology, Chemistry, English, History, Mathematics, Physics, and Spanish. Upon completion of the program, students are recommended for initial licensure in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Secondary Education in History
Requirements: To apply as a first-year student, please submit the following: Completed Application (online), Official High School Transcript, Essay or Personal Statement, Letter of Recommendation (one), SAT/ACT Scores (optional for most majors).
Description: The Secondary Education major, leading to a Bachelor of Arts, prepares you to teach at the middle and high school level (grades 5–12). You will choose a major in a content area—Biology, Chemistry, English, History, or Mathematics—and combine it with an Education major. As an Education major, you will complete the professional coursework for licensure as well as the Massachusetts Tests for Educator Licensure (MTELs) required by the Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education. Our program is approved by the Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education.
Accredidation: Approved by the Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Actuarial Science
Requirements:
To apply for admission as a first-year student, the following is required:

- Completed Application (either the Western New England University Application or the Common Application)
- Official High School Transcript(s)
- One Letter of Recommendation (from a teacher or school counselor)
- Personal Essay or Graded Paper
- SAT/ACT Scores (Optional)
Description: Are you a problem solver with a knack for mathematics? Do you enjoy predicting future financial events and helping people plan for them? If so, consider the actuarial science program at Western New England University. Our Actuarial Science BS degree provides students with a strong foundation in mathematics, statistics, and financial theory, equipping them with the skills necessary to become successful actuaries. You will learn to analyze and manage financial risks, develop and price insurance products, and assess the solvency of insurance companies and pension plans. Our program has been recognized by the Society of Actuaries as meeting their VEE (Validation by Educational Experience) requirements in Economics, Corporate Finance, and Applied Statistical Methods, which means you can satisfy these requirements through specific courses at WNE. Our faculty are dedicated to providing you with an outstanding actuarial education. They have extensive experience in the field, with many holding professional actuarial designations such as ASA (Associate of the Society of Actuaries) and FSA (Fellow of the Society of Actuaries). Our curriculum is designed to prepare you for the challenging preliminary actuarial exams administered by the Society of Actuaries and Casualty Actuarial Society. We offer comprehensive courses covering topics such as financial mathematics, probability, statistics, economics, and corporate finance. Our small class sizes allow for individualized attention and foster a collaborative learning environment. You will have opportunities to work on real-world case studies and projects, gaining practical experience in risk assessment and financial modeling. We also offer internships with insurance companies and consulting firms, providing valuable hands-on experience and networking opportunities. Upon graduation, you will be well-prepared for a rewarding career as an actuary in a variety of industries, including insurance, consulting, government, and finance.
Accredidation: Recognized by the Society of Actuaries as meeting their VEE (Validation by Educational Experience) requirements in Economics, Corporate Finance, and Applied Statistical Methods.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Bioengineering and Biomedical Engineering
Requirements: Application requirements for first-year students include a completed application (either the WNE Application or the Common Application), official high school transcript(s), one letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor, and a personal essay. Students applying to Engineering programs, including Biomedical Engineering, are required to submit SAT or ACT scores.
Description:
Biomedical Engineering is the application of engineering principles and design concepts to medicine and biology for healthcare purposes (e.g., diagnostic or therapeutic). This field seeks to close the gap between engineering and medicine, combining the design and problem-solving skills of engineering with medical and biological sciences to advance healthcare treatment, including diagnosis, monitoring, and therapy.

Biomedical engineers can be found in a variety of industries, including medical device companies, biotechnology companies, pharmaceutical companies, hospitals, and government regulatory agencies. Many go on to medical school or to pursue graduate studies in biomedical engineering. In addition to a core curriculum of math, science, and engineering, the curriculum offers flexibility to explore interest areas through electives such as artificial intelligence, medical imaging, bioinstrumentation, biomaterials, and biomechanics.

As a Biomedical Engineering major at Western New England University, you will have the opportunity to engage in cutting-edge research alongside faculty, participate in internships with leading companies in the field, and gain valuable hands-on experience in our state-of-the-art laboratories. Our program is designed to prepare you for a successful career in this rapidly growing and evolving field.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Science program in Biomedical Engineering is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.

Requirements: Applicants must submit a completed application (either the Common Application or the Western New England University Application), official high school transcript(s), at least one letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor, and an essay or personal statement.
Description: Western New England University’s Biology program will immerse you in the study of living organisms, their structure, function, growth, origin, evolution, and distribution. You will gain extensive knowledge and hands-on laboratory experience, preparing you for a wide range of careers in biology, health sciences, and other science-related fields. Our curriculum provides you with a broad foundation in biological principles, encompassing genetics, cellular and molecular biology, ecology, and physiology. You will develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills essential for scientific inquiry and professional success. With a strong emphasis on research and experiential learning, our program encourages students to engage in faculty-mentored projects, internships, and field experiences, allowing you to apply classroom knowledge to real-world challenges. Whether you aspire to pursue advanced degrees, become a healthcare professional, or contribute to scientific discovery, the Biology program at Western New England University offers a dynamic and supportive environment to achieve your goals.

A Bachelor of Science in Chemistry is offered with a curriculum approved by the American Chemical Society. Students who successfully complete this program are certified to the American Chemical Society (ACS). Western New England University's Bachelor of Science in Chemistry program provides a comprehensive background in all areas of modern chemistry. You will develop a strong foundation in general, organic, analytical, physical, and inorganic chemistry, as well as biochemistry. Our program is designed to develop highly skilled and knowledgeable chemists with a strong foundation for a variety of scientific and professional careers. As a chemistry major, you will gain hands-on experience with instrumentation and research projects alongside faculty, preparing you for a diverse range of opportunities in industry, research, healthcare, and graduate studies. The program emphasizes both theoretical knowledge and practical skills, ensuring you are well-equipped for challenges in the chemical sciences.
Accredidation: American Chemical Society (ACS) - Approved curriculum and graduates certified.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering
Concentration: Structural Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Transportation Engineering, Construction Management
Description: Are you interested in designing infrastructure like roads, bridges, buildings, and water treatment plants? With a Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering, you'll learn how to build the vital structures that form the foundation of our society. Through hands-on learning, design projects, and internships, you'll develop the skills to be a leader in the field of civil engineering. Our ABET-accredited program emphasizes a broad-based curriculum, preparing you for a wide range of careers in both the public and private sectors, or for graduate study.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org, under the General Criteria and the Program Criteria for Civil and Similarly Named Engineering Programs.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering
Description: Computer engineering is the design and analysis of computer hardware and software. The computer engineering program at Western New England University offers an excellent balance of computer science and electrical engineering courses and covers areas of study such as embedded systems design, computer architecture, digital signal processing, robotics, and integrated circuits. Hands-on learning is integrated into all four years of the program, with courses that feature laboratories, projects, and design experiences using state-of-the-art software and hardware. In your senior year, you’ll work as part of a team on a two-semester capstone design project that challenges you to apply the knowledge and skills you’ve gained to solve a real-world engineering problem.
Accredidation: All of our undergraduate engineering programs (Biomedical, Civil, Computer, Electrical, Industrial, and Mechanical) are accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, www.abet.org.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
Description: As computers become more integrated into our lives, the need for computer scientists who can develop new and innovative technology grows. Western New England University’s Bachelor of Science in Computer Science degree program prepares you for an exciting and rewarding career as a computer scientist, with a rigorous curriculum in programming, algorithms, data structures, operating systems, networking, and software engineering. You’ll be prepared for immediate entry into industry, or to continue your education in graduate school.
Accredidation: The Computer Science (BS) program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice
Requirements: Required application materials include: Completed Common Application or Western New England University Application, Official High School Transcript, One Letter of Recommendation from a teacher or school counselor. WNE is a Test Optional institution. Submission of SAT or ACT scores is optional for most majors.
Description: The Criminal Justice program at Western New England University provides students with an exciting and challenging course of study related to the criminal justice system. Our curriculum emphasizes a liberal arts foundation that provides students with strong writing, critical thinking, and communication skills necessary for success in a variety of criminal justice-related careers. In addition, students gain significant knowledge regarding the law, law enforcement, courts, corrections, and homeland security. Our program features highly qualified and experienced faculty, hands-on learning experiences, and opportunities to connect with criminal justice practitioners.

From your smartphone to your car, virtually every aspect of modern life has a digital component that needs to be protected from malicious actors. The Bachelor of Science in Cybersecurity at Western New England University will provide you with the knowledge and hands-on skills to address the growing need to protect crucial data. You will learn to manage risk and identify and prevent cyberattacks in government, the military, and the private sector. Through a combination of coursework, state-of-the-art labs, hands-on learning, and a required internship, you will develop the skills to be a successful cybersecurity professional. Our Cybersecurity program emphasizes professional experience through opportunities with our Career Center, student organizations, and a required internship. Our dedicated faculty members are committed to your success and will provide you with personal attention and professional guidance, enabling you to secure a position in this high-demand field. You’ll be prepared for careers such as a Security Analyst, Information Security Engineer, Forensic Computer Analyst, IT Security Consultant, Penetration Tester, and Chief Information Security Officer.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Data Science and Statistics
Requirements: To apply, students must submit either the Common Application or the Western New England University Application, an official high school transcript, one letter of recommendation, and an essay or personal statement. Standardized test scores (SAT/ACT) are optional for the BS in Data Science and Statistics program.
Description: Data Science and Statistics combines the areas of mathematics, statistics, and computer science into an interdisciplinary field that addresses the challenges of extracting meaningful insights from complex data. Data scientists and statisticians are in high demand across many industries and organizations. Our curriculum combines theoretical foundations with practical applications, including hands-on experience with statistical software, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools. As a graduate of our Data Science and Statistics program, you will be able to: Apply appropriate statistical methods and data science techniques to analyze and interpret complex data sets. Utilize programming languages and software tools for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization. Communicate effectively the results of data analysis to both technical and non-technical audiences. Understand the ethical considerations and limitations of data-driven decision-making. Collaborate effectively in interdisciplinary teams to address real-world data challenges.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering
Description: Electrical Engineering at Western New England University combines theoretical knowledge with practical, hands-on application—starting with your first year. You’ll be challenged to design, develop, test, and supervise the manufacture of electrical equipment, such as electric motors, radar and navigation systems, communications systems, and power generation equipment. Electrical engineering is a broad field with many areas of specialization. The comprehensive curriculum allows you to study courses in power systems, electronics, microprocessors, control systems, and electromagnetics. You’ll be prepared for an exciting career path in industries such as energy, robotics, automotive, aerospace, communications, and consumer electronics.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, http://www.abet.org.

Requirements: To apply for first-year admission, applicants must submit a completed Common Application or the WNE Application, official high school transcript(s), one letter of recommendation (from a teacher or school counselor), and a Personal Essay/Writing Sample. Submission of SAT/ACT scores is optional.
Description: In a global economy, finance majors are in high demand to help organizations and individuals manage and grow their financial assets. From the stock market to personal savings, finance professionals help people, companies, and organizations make smart money decisions. When you major in Finance at Western New England University, you will be prepared for a wide array of career opportunities in the field of financial services, financial management, investment management, real estate, and more. Our experienced faculty will teach you the quantitative and analytical skills needed to succeed as a finance professional. You will learn how to analyze markets, manage portfolios, and make sound financial decisions. The Bachelor of Science in Finance provides a comprehensive curriculum that covers areas such as corporate finance, investments, financial institutions, and international finance. What makes WNE Finance unique includes hands-on experience with real-world financial tools, including Bloomberg Terminal Certification and participation in the CFA Institute Research Challenge; access to the state-of-the-art Center for Finance and Analytics; the opportunity to manage a portion of the University’s endowment, gaining practical investment management experience; a strong emphasis on ethical decision-making in finance; and internship opportunities with leading financial firms. Upon graduation, objectives for graduates include possessing a strong foundation in financial theory and practice, demonstrating quantitative and analytical skills to solve complex financial problems, being able to apply ethical principles to financial decision-making, and being prepared for successful careers in diverse areas of finance or for further graduate study. Career opportunities for finance majors include: Financial Analyst, Investment Banker, Portfolio Manager, Risk Manager, Financial Planner, Corporate Finance Manager, Real Estate Analyst, and more.
Accredidation: The College of Business, which houses the Finance program, is accredited by AACSB International, the premier accrediting body for business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Forensic Biology
Requirements: To apply for admission, please submit the following: The Common Application or the Western New England University Application, Official High School Transcript(s), One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor is required, An essay or personal statement is required. Western New England University is Test Optional. Submission of SAT or ACT scores are not required for admission for most majors.
Description: Western New England University offers the only Bachelor of Science (BS) in Forensic Biology in New England. This interdisciplinary program, housed in the Department of Biology in the College of Arts and Sciences, combines a strong foundation in biology, chemistry, and criminal justice with specialized courses in forensic science. You will delve into areas such as DNA analysis, toxicology, serology, microscopy, and forensic pathology. The curriculum provides a strong theoretical background along with extensive hands-on laboratory experience, preparing you for a wide range of careers in forensic science, graduate studies, or professional programs. Our graduates are highly sought after by state and federal crime labs, hospitals, and private forensic companies. The program also prepares students for graduate studies in forensic science or medical school.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Forensic Chemistry
Requirements:
Required Application Materials:
- Completed Application for Admission: We accept the Common Application or the Western New England University Application.
- Official High School Transcript(s): Please have your school counselor send your official high school transcript(s) to us electronically (if possible) or by mail.
- One Letter of Recommendation: From a school counselor or teacher.
- Essay/Personal Statement: We want to learn more about you!
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Forensic Chemistry provides you with a comprehensive understanding of the chemical principles, analytical techniques, and legal aspects essential for a career in forensic science. Our curriculum integrates rigorous scientific training with practical, hands-on experience, preparing you to apply chemical analysis to criminal investigations and legal proceedings. You will gain expertise in areas such as toxicology, drug analysis, trace evidence, and forensic serology. Additionally, you will develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills, which are vital for presenting scientific findings in a court of law. Upon graduation, you will be well-prepared for roles in crime labs, law enforcement agencies, and environmental monitoring, or for pursuing advanced degrees in forensic science or related fields.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Health Sciences (Pre-Optometry concentration)
Department: College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Health Sciences is a flexible major that prepares students for a variety of careers in allied health and public health professions, or for graduate-level studies leading to a career as a physician assistant, physical therapist, occupational therapist, chiropractor, or other health practitioner. Our curriculum helps students build a strong foundation in human anatomy and physiology, chemistry, biology, and physics, along with courses in research design and statistics. A hallmark of the program is the opportunity to tailor coursework to meet students’ specific career goals through a variety of elective options and hands-on experiences. Students can choose from concentrations including Pre-Optometry, Pre-Physician Assistant, Pre-Physical Therapy, Pre-Occupational Therapy, and Public Health.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Health Sciences (Pre-Physician's Assistant concentration)
Department: College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: A Bachelor of Science degree in Health Sciences from Western New England University provides students with a strong foundation in science, preparing them for advanced studies in a variety of health professions or for entry-level positions in the healthcare industry. Our comprehensive curriculum includes courses in biology, chemistry, physics, and mathematics, along with specialized courses in areas such as anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology. Students will also develop critical thinking, communication, and problem-solving skills, essential for success in healthcare. With opportunities for hands-on experience through internships and clinical placements, graduates are well-prepared for diverse career paths.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Health Studies (3+3 OTD option)
Requirements: Application requirements include a completed Common Application or Western New England University Application, official high school transcript(s), one letter of recommendation, and an essay or personal statement. The 3+3 Doctor of Occupational Therapy (OTD) option is an exception to the University's test-optional policy and requires standardized test scores. To be considered for direct entry from high school, applicants must have a minimum cumulative high school GPA of 3.3, and an SAT score of 1100 (Evidence-Based Reading and Writing and Math) or an ACT composite score of 22.
Department: College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: Our Bachelor of Science in Health Studies program offers a pathway to prepare you for a variety of careers in healthcare. Students in our program have the option to enter into several accelerated pathways for graduate study at WNE, including Occupational Therapy, Physical Therapy, and Pharmacy. These accelerated programs are competitive admission and require a strong academic record. The 3+3 OTD option allows qualified students to earn both a bachelor’s degree in Health Studies and a Doctor of Occupational Therapy (OTD) degree in six years instead of seven, saving a year of tuition costs. If you are admitted into the 3+3 OTD option, you will complete three years of undergraduate coursework and then automatically matriculate into the Doctor of Occupational Therapy program upon successful completion of your undergraduate requirements. The curriculum offers a strong foundation in the natural and social sciences and a focus on critical thinking, problem-solving, communication, and professionalism to prepare you for graduate studies or employment in the healthcare field. In your third year, you will complete a capstone internship in a healthcare setting to apply classroom learning and gain valuable experience. This program focuses on developing knowledge and skills in key healthcare areas such as: Interprofessional healthcare practice, Public health, Disease prevention and health promotion, Healthcare ethics, Healthcare policy, Healthcare delivery systems.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering
Requirements: To apply for admission, first-year students must submit the following: Completed Common Application or the Western New England University Application (no fee), Official High School Transcript, One Letter of Recommendation (from a teacher or school counselor), Personal Essay.
Description: Industrial engineering is all about making things work better, faster, safer, and more efficiently. At Western New England University, our ABET-accredited Industrial Engineering program prepares you to design, improve, and install integrated systems of people, materials, information, equipment, and energy for a variety of industries. You will learn to apply specialized knowledge and skills in the mathematical, physical, and social sciences, along with the principles and methods of engineering analysis and design, to specify, predict, and evaluate the results to be obtained from such systems.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, www.abet.org.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology
Requirements: To be considered for admission as a first-year student, you will need to submit the following: Common Application or WNE Application; Official high school transcript(s); One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor; SAT or ACT scores (optional for most programs*).
Concentration: Cybersecurity, Data Analytics, Game Development, Network Administration, Programming and Software Development, Web Development
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Information Technology (BSIT) program at Purdue Global helps prepare you with the knowledge and skills for entry-level to mid-level positions within a variety of industries. Through our online information technology degree, you will learn to administer, secure, design, and manage information technology assets, including databases, networks, programming, and web systems. The curriculum helps you develop a solid foundation in the core concepts of information technology through an interdisciplinary curriculum grounded in business principles and best practices. You will gain experience in a wide range of current and emerging technologies relevant to IT departments across industries. You will be exposed to technical concepts in programming, database management, web systems, operating systems, networking, and security. In addition, you will refine your critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills to give you a competitive advantage in the workplace. The BSIT curriculum is continually updated to align with the ever-changing IT field and employer demands.
Accredidation: Purdue Global is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission (HLC). Additionally, the Bachelor of Science in Information Technology is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Management Sciences and Information Systems

Requirements: A completed Common Application or WNE Application; Official high school transcript(s) including senior year first quarter/trimester grades; One letter of recommendation from a school counselor or a teacher who has taught you in an academic course (English, math, science, social studies, or world language); Personal Essay (included with application).
Concentration: Sales Management, Digital Marketing, Sport Management
Description: Marketing is one of the most exciting and dynamic career fields. It involves understanding consumer behavior and creating, communicating, delivering, and exchanging offerings that have value for consumers, clients, partners, and society at large. Our comprehensive Bachelor of Science in Marketing program provides you with the skills and knowledge you need to become a successful marketing professional, including marketing management, marketing research, and professional selling. Our Bachelor of Science in Marketing program is designed to develop a broad understanding of marketing principles and practices. You'll gain skills in areas such as market analysis, product development, pricing strategies, distribution channels, and promotional campaigns. In addition to a broad education in marketing fundamentals, you'll have the opportunity to specialize in a particular aspect of the field. Customize your studies by choosing from specialized concentrations in: Sales Management, Digital Marketing, or Sport Management. Marketing graduates are prepared for a variety of roles in diverse industries, including sales management, advertising, brand management, digital marketing, market research, public relations, and retail management. Our alumni secure positions at leading companies and organizations, such as PepsiCo, IBM, MassMutual, and the New England Revolution.
Accredidation: The College of Business and its programs are accredited by AACSB International—the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Mathematical Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Mathematical Sciences focuses on developing critical thinking, quantitative reasoning, and problem-solving skills, and preparing students for careers in diverse fields such as data science, finance, engineering, and education, or for advanced study in mathematics and related disciplines. The program offers three concentrations: Applied Mathematics, Data Science, and Pure Mathematics. Students are encouraged to pursue an internship, which provides valuable experience in the application of mathematics in a professional setting. The small class sizes and personalized attention from faculty, combined with extensive use of technology and computing, contribute to a comprehensive and engaging learning experience.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering
Requirements: To apply for admission as a first-year student, you will need to submit the following: A completed application (You may apply using the Common Application or the WNE Application. Both are FREE.); Official high school transcript; One letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher; Personal Essay/Writing Sample.
Description: Engineers in the field of mechanical engineering are at the forefront of the design, analysis, and creation of products, systems, and processes. They are problem solvers with skills ranging from technical expertise to communication and leadership. From the development of sophisticated robots and artificial intelligence to biomedical devices and alternative energy systems, mechanical engineers are involved in every phase of the engineering process. As a mechanical engineering student at Western New England University, you will have the opportunity to engage in hands-on projects both inside and outside the classroom. You'll gain a strong foundation in core mechanical engineering principles with the flexibility to customize your curriculum to your interests. Our program emphasizes design and experiential learning, preparing you for a successful and impactful career. Whether your passion lies in robotics, aerospace, sustainable energy, or manufacturing, a Mechanical Engineering degree from WNE will equip you with the knowledge and skills to innovate and lead in a rapidly evolving world.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Science (BS) program in Mechanical Engineering is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, Inc.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Neuroscience and Neurobiology
Requirements: To apply as a first-year student, you will need the following: A completed Common Application or WNE Application, Official high school transcript, Official SAT I or ACT scores (if you choose to submit them), One letter of recommendation from a teacher or guidance/college counselor, A college essay or personal statement.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Neuroscience and Neurobiology is an interdisciplinary major with coursework spanning Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, and Psychology. Our program gives you a deep understanding of the structure and function of the nervous system. You will explore the relationship between the nervous system, behavior, and cognitive function at the molecular, cellular, and systems level. As a student in this program, you will gain hands-on experience by completing laboratory coursework that includes modern techniques in molecular biology, neuroanatomy, neurophysiology, and animal behavior. You will be prepared for postgraduate studies in neuroscience or related fields and for careers in biomedical research, pharmaceuticals, and health professions.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Network, Database, and System Administration
Requirements: To apply as a first-year student, you will need the following: Completed Common Application or the Western New England University Application, Official high school transcript(s), Official standardized test scores (SAT or ACT). Western New England University is a test optional institution for most majors, Letter of Recommendation, Personal Essay/Personal Statement.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences
Department: College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Concentration: Pre-Pharmacy, Pharmaceutical Marketing and Management, Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences program offers students a strong foundation in the chemical and biological sciences while also providing an understanding of the business and manufacturing aspects of the pharmaceutical industry. This program is offered as a four-year, direct-entry program for high school students. Students will gain an understanding of the drug discovery and development process, drug manufacturing, pharmaceutical marketing and sales, and the ethical issues faced by the pharmaceutical industry. The program will prepare students for careers in the pharmaceutical industry and related fields, or for further graduate study in pharmacy, pharmacology, or other health sciences. Graduates of the program are also eligible for the preferred admission pathway to the Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) program at Western New England University. This preferred admission pathway includes specific requirements for maintaining preferred admission status. For more information, please contact the Office of Admissions.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Psychology (3+3 OTD option)
Requirements: Students must meet the standard undergraduate admissions criteria and indicate their interest in the 3+3 Doctor of Occupational Therapy (OTD) program on their undergraduate application. Required application materials include a completed Common Application or Golden Bear Application, official high school transcript(s), a Secondary School Report Form and a letter of recommendation from a school counselor, and a letter of recommendation from a teacher.
Description:
The 3+3 OTD Option allows qualified students to complete their Bachelor of Science in Psychology degree and their Doctor of Occupational Therapy degree in six years rather than seven, thereby saving one year of tuition. Students apply to the OTD program in their third year of undergraduate study. If accepted, students complete all requirements for the BS in Psychology degree (121 credits) by the end of their third year of undergraduate study and enter the Doctor of Occupational Therapy program (94 credits) in their fourth year. Students are required to maintain a cumulative GPA of 3.300 or higher and a Science GPA of 3.000 or higher with no science grade lower than a C in order to remain eligible for the 3+3 OTD Option. In addition, students are required to complete a minimum of 20 observation hours in two different occupational therapy practice settings prior to applying to the OTD program.

Students successfully completing all requirements will be awarded a BS in Psychology at the end of their fourth year (which is their first year in the OTD program) and a Doctor of Occupational Therapy degree at the completion of the Doctor of Occupational Therapy program.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Robotics and Automation Engineering
Requirements:
To be considered for admission, first-year applicants must submit the following:

- A completed application for admission, including an essay. Western New England University accepts the Common Application.
- An official high school transcript.
- An official record of your SAT and/or ACT scores (optional for most programs).
- One letter of recommendation from your school counselor or a teacher.
Description: Robotics and automation is revolutionizing every industry, from manufacturing and medicine to exploration and entertainment. Our Bachelor of Science in Robotics Engineering degree will prepare you for a future in this exciting and rapidly expanding field. You’ll learn to design, develop, and control intelligent machines that can perform tasks autonomously or semi-autonomously. This program provides a strong foundation in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, and computer science, with a focus on integrating these disciplines to create sophisticated robotic systems. You'll gain hands-on experience through laboratory work, projects, and internships, giving you the practical skills and knowledge needed to succeed in a wide range of industries.
Accredidation: Our Bachelor of Science in Robotics Engineering degree is designed to meet the rigorous accreditation standards of ABET.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education in Biology
Requirements: To be considered for admission, first-year applicants must submit the following: Completed Common Application or Western New England University Application; Official high school transcript; One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor; Essay/Personal Statement; Official SAT or ACT Scores (optional).
Description: Students pursuing a secondary education licensure complete a bachelor’s degree in their chosen content area and a secondary education minor. This minor consists of 36–39 credits of professional education coursework and two pre-practicum field experiences (75 hours each) prior to a full-time, 16-week supervised student teaching practicum. Secondary education majors develop the skills necessary to teach their content area in a middle school or high school setting. They learn how to create a positive and safe classroom environment, develop engaging lesson plans, address the needs of diverse learners, and assess student learning. Our program culminates in a full-time practicum experience, which provides an opportunity to develop teaching skills in a supervised setting. Graduates are eligible for an Initial License in Massachusetts and are prepared to teach in a wide variety of middle school and high school settings.
Accredidation: All of our education programs are approved by the Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education in Chemistry
Requirements: To apply for admission as a first-year student, you will need to submit the following: Completed Common Application or Western New England University Application, including the essay and application fee; Official high school transcript; One letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher. Western New England University is a test-optional institution. Submission of SAT or ACT test scores is not required for admission for most programs.
Description: The Secondary Education Program prepares students to be secondary school teachers. The program provides the professional preparation necessary to teach in grades 8-12. Courses include general academic requirements, core courses in teaching methodology and clinical experience, and content area coursework in an academic major. The program emphasizes inquiry-based teaching, collaboration, reflection, and the integration of technology.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education in Mathematics
Description: The Department of Education offers undergraduate and graduate programs leading to teacher licensure in a wide range of areas, including elementary education, special education, and secondary education. Secondary Education majors pursue a Bachelor of Arts in English or History or a Bachelor of Science in Biology, Chemistry, General Science, Mathematics, or Physics, which includes their content area, a set of education courses, and fieldwork that together lead to initial teacher licensure in Massachusetts for grades 8-12. Upon graduation, students majoring in one of the Education programs will be able to: Apply the knowledge of theories and current research related to teaching and learning within varied contexts and populations. Design and implement culturally and linguistically responsive learning environments that provide for the safety, health, and well-being of all learners. Develop and implement coherent instruction and assessment strategies that address learners’ diverse strengths and needs in order to promote a sense of belonging and academic success. Collaborate with others to advocate for equitable practices in educational systems.
Accredidation: Western New England University's undergraduate and graduate education programs are approved by the Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education. In addition, the undergraduate Elementary and Secondary Education programs and the Master of Arts in Teaching program are fully accredited by the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator Preparation (AAQEP).

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Sport and Fitness Management
Associate of Arts in Liberal Studies

Description: The Accounting minor is a great way to complement a wide array of majors in both business and other disciplines. An understanding of accounting is valuable in all aspects of life and business, and the WNE Accounting minor is designed to help you gain that understanding. A minor in accounting may be beneficial for students studying finance, management, marketing, computer information systems, and any other major that requires the understanding of financial information. This minor will give you a fundamental understanding of accounting principles and prepare you for careers in a variety of fields, including finance, management, and marketing.
Accredidation: Western New England University's College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, the premier accrediting agency for business programs worldwide. This distinction places us among the top 5% of all business schools globally.

Description: Complement any major and develop your creative side by completing a minor in Art. At Western New England University, our Art minor allows you to explore various forms of art, including drawing, painting, and sculpture, while also studying the history of art. You will develop your artistic skills by taking hands-on studio courses in topics such as ceramics, printmaking, and graphic design, as well as by completing a required art portfolio. Plus, you will have the flexibility to select additional studio art courses that pique your interest. The Minor in Art requires 18 credits. The curriculum consists of three credits in Art History (ART 100), nine credits in studio courses, and six additional credits in Art electives. As part of your nine studio credits, you are required to take either ART 105 or ART 106. Your electives can be any additional studio art courses or any courses within the department. No portfolio review is required for admission to the Art minor.

Requirements: A minor in Athletic Coaching is available to all undergraduate students. Students must first be admitted to an undergraduate degree program at the university. Application requirements for first-year undergraduate admission include a completed application (Common Application or WNE Application), official high school transcript, an essay or personal statement, and one letter of recommendation. Western New England University is Test-Optional, meaning SAT and ACT scores are not required for admission.
Description: The Athletic Coaching minor at Western New England University is designed to prepare students with the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively coach athletes in various sports settings. This interdisciplinary minor combines courses from Exercise Science, Business, and Communication to provide a comprehensive understanding of coaching principles, sports psychology, athletic training, and leadership. Students will learn how to develop training programs, foster teamwork, manage athletic programs, and communicate effectively with athletes, parents, and administrators. The curriculum emphasizes ethical considerations, athlete well-being, and the practical application of coaching strategies. This minor is ideal for students passionate about sports and interested in pursuing coaching careers at the youth, high school, or collegiate levels, as well as those looking to enhance their leadership skills in any profession.

The Biology minor is suitable for students in other scientific majors, such as Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Pharmacy, and Chemistry, who are interested in deepening their knowledge of biology. It is also suitable for students in other majors who wish to demonstrate an interest in biology to prepare for careers in healthcare or biotechnology. Biology courses are offered with a hands-on approach and small class sizes. You will have opportunities to engage in independent research with faculty, participate in summer research programs, present at scientific conferences, and intern with area organizations.

Requirements: As this is a minor, students declare it after being admitted to the university. The general requirements for first-year admission to Western New England University include: a completed Common Application or Western New England University Application, an official high school transcript, and one letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor. Western New England University is a test-optional institution for most programs.

The Minor in Business is designed to provide the non-business major with a solid foundation in the general concepts of business. To declare a minor, students should speak to their advisor and complete a form available through the appropriate Dean's office.
Description: A Business Minor is a great way to complement your undergraduate major. It allows you to gain a strong foundation in business principles without committing to a full major. You'll learn essential business skills that are valuable in any profession, from marketing and finance to management and accounting. Students who complete the Business Minor will be able to: Analyze business situations using critical thinking skills; Apply fundamental business concepts and principles across various disciplines; Communicate effectively in a professional business environment; Understand the ethical responsibilities of business professionals; Utilize quantitative skills to make informed business decisions.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, the premier accrediting body for business schools worldwide.

Description: This minor is designed for students interested in working on political campaigns, running for office, working in a politician's office, or who wish to become engaged and educated citizens. Students will learn the essentials of how political campaigns are run, how voters make decisions, how to craft persuasive political messages, and how to effectively raise money.

A minor in Chemistry is an excellent complement for majors in areas such as biology, forensic biology, and pre-med. It also allows students in other majors, such as engineering, to develop an understanding of the chemical principles fundamental to modern technology. The minor in Chemistry consists of 20 credits, including four required courses (CHE 113, 114, 213, 214) and one 4-credit 300- or 400-level Chemistry elective.

Communication is a vital field relevant to every profession and sector. A minor in Communication can complement nearly every major, enhancing your skillset and expanding your career prospects. Through a flexible curriculum, you will delve into how individuals, groups, and organizations communicate. You'll develop strong communication skills, critical thinking abilities, and a nuanced understanding of human interaction, all highly sought after in today's dynamic job market. Our dedicated faculty will guide you through courses that cover a wide range of communication areas, including interpersonal communication, public relations, media studies, organizational communication, and intercultural communication. You’ll gain practical experience through hands-on projects, discussions, and real-world case studies, preparing you for success in various fields, from marketing and public relations to education and law. Whether you're looking to strengthen your persuasive abilities, improve your writing and presentation skills, or better understand media and cultural influences, a minor in Communication will equip you with invaluable tools for personal and professional growth.

The Minor in Computer Forensics program provides students with the foundational knowledge of computer systems and networks, operating systems, and computer programming, as well as the specialized knowledge of cyber forensics and incident response. This knowledge base will enable students to analyze cyberattacks and digital evidence, identify and trace perpetrators, and respond to cyber incidents effectively and efficiently. The minor provides students with the critical knowledge and skills necessary to pursue a career in the rapidly growing field of computer forensics, as well as prepares students to pursue advanced degrees in cybersecurity and related fields. The minor program is a valuable complement to majors in Criminal Justice, Information Technology, Cyber Security, Computer Science, and Business.

The Minor in Computer Science is offered by the Department of Computer Science and Cybersecurity. Students pursuing a minor in Computer Science gain foundational knowledge in the field through a core set of courses that cover programming concepts, data structures, and algorithms. This minor complements a wide range of majors, providing valuable computational skills that are increasingly essential in diverse professional fields.

The Creative Writing Minor at Western New England University provides students with an opportunity to hone their skills as writers of fiction, poetry, and creative nonfiction. Under the guidance of published and award-winning authors, students will master the craft of writing through exploring various forms, styles, and literary devices; developing a critical vocabulary for analyzing writing; and participating in a vibrant community of fellow writers. With opportunities for both classroom study and public performance, the Creative Writing Minor enables students to develop their imaginative talents, improve their analytical skills, and express themselves powerfully through the written word.

A minor in Criminal Justice can enhance a variety of majors in both the liberal arts and sciences and in the professional schools. The minor offers students the opportunity to learn about the criminal justice system in the United States, including theories of crime and criminal behavior, the operation of police, courts, and corrections agencies, and topics in homeland security.

Western New England University's Minor in Cybersecurity provides students with a strong foundation in cybersecurity principles, technologies, and practices. This interdisciplinary minor prepares students to address the increasing demand for cybersecurity professionals across various industries. Students will gain practical skills in network security, ethical hacking, digital forensics, and risk management, making them valuable assets in protecting digital assets and information.

Explore the exciting and fast-paced world of digital marketing with a minor that will help you gain a deep understanding of marketing in the digital age. You will learn the strategies, tactics, and tools necessary to effectively promote products, services, and brands online. Coursework in the minor includes a range of topics, such as social media marketing, search engine optimization (SEO), content marketing, email marketing, web analytics, and digital advertising. By developing a comprehensive skill set in digital marketing, you will be well-prepared for a variety of roles across industries. Combine this minor with any major to open doors to exciting career opportunities, whether you are interested in marketing, communications, business, or any field where a strong digital presence is crucial.

Economics focuses on how human societies deal with scarcity. Resources are limited, but human wants are virtually unlimited. The economics discipline explores how individuals, businesses, and governments make choices to satisfy their wants and needs. The study of economics helps students develop problem-solving and critical-thinking skills. It also provides a better understanding of how the world works. A minor in Economics complements many majors, including Business, Law, Liberal Arts, and the Sciences. An understanding of economic principles is especially useful for students interested in careers in business, law, public policy, or international affairs. It’s also an excellent choice for those interested in graduate school in economics, business, or law. The minor in Economics requires five courses (15 credits) in economics.

The Education minor is designed for students who are interested in pursuing a career in teaching or other education-related fields. The minor provides students with a foundational understanding of educational theories, practices, and policies. Students will explore topics such as child development, instructional strategies, classroom management, and educational technology. The minor also includes practical experiences, such as observations in local schools, to give students a firsthand look at the teaching profession. This minor, along with required professional courses beyond the minor, will help prepare students to apply for state licensure for elementary or secondary teaching positions, provided a Bachelor’s degree has been earned in a related content area and all state licensure requirements have been met. This minor is particularly suited for students majoring in areas such as English, History, Mathematics, Science, or Psychology who are considering a career in teaching.
ScholarshipType: Merit scholarships, Need-based grants, Endowed/Restricted Scholarships

Description: A minor in English provides students in any major with the opportunity to refine their analytical and communication skills in critical reading, thinking, and writing. These skills are important for successful careers across disciplines and for successful lives as informed citizens. Students will study literary and other texts in a variety of genres, from different historical periods, and with an eye to diverse cultural traditions and perspectives. The minor offers maximum flexibility so that students can shape their coursework to best support their particular interests and career goals. Students choose four English courses (12 credits) from a rich array of offerings. The minor consists of 12 credits of courses in English (EN). No more than 3 credits from the 100 level can count toward the minor.

ProgramName: Minor in Enterprise Resource Planning with SAP
Description: Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems integrate internal and external management information across an entire organization and automate many business functions related to operations, production, and distribution, as well as finance, accounting, and human resources. This minor will provide students with both theoretical and practical knowledge of ERP, and specifically with SAP, the global leader in ERP software. Students will acquire valuable experience with cutting-edge ERP technology by learning the fundamentals of the SAP system and how it supports business processes within an organization. Students will gain experience in using various SAP modules and learn how ERP systems are implemented in different functional areas. This minor will give students a competitive advantage in the job market, as employers are increasingly seeking graduates with ERP knowledge and SAP experience.

The entertainment industry is one of the fastest growing industries. Through a minor in Entertainment Management at Western New England University, students will develop a deep understanding of the diverse landscape of the entertainment industry including, but not limited to, sports, music, film, television, and gaming. Coursework for the minor will introduce students to topics in marketing, finance, and the legal aspects of this exciting field. This minor is an excellent complement to majors in Business, Communication, and Sport Management, and can provide a competitive edge in any career where an understanding of this growing industry would be beneficial.

Requirements: Students who wish to pursue a minor should consult with their academic advisor and the department chair for the minor. To declare a minor, students should obtain the Declaration of Minor form from the dean’s office of their respective college.
Description: Entrepreneurship isn't just about starting a business. It's about developing the skills to identify problems and create innovative solutions, whether for a startup, an existing company, or a nonprofit. The Minor in Entrepreneurship provides students with a foundational understanding of entrepreneurial principles and practices. You will learn to think critically, identify opportunities, develop business plans, secure funding, and launch ventures. This minor is open to all majors and complements a variety of fields, preparing you to be an innovator and leader in any industry.

As a minor in Environmental Science, you will develop a deep understanding of the interactions between humans and the natural environment. Courses include the natural and social sciences, as well as the humanities. You will also develop a greater awareness of the legal, ethical, and economic aspects of environmental issues, so you can work toward a sustainable future.

The Minor in Film Studies allows students in any major to examine film as both a medium of entertainment and a significant art form. The program helps students develop skills in aesthetic judgment, critical analysis, and historical understanding of film. Through a variety of courses, students will explore different film genres, movements, and cultural contexts. The minor complements a wide range of majors by enhancing students’ abilities to interpret visual narratives and to engage critically with various forms of media, preparing them for diverse career paths that require strong analytical and communication skills.

A minor in finance will provide you with a solid foundation in the principles of financial management, investments, and financial markets. It is an excellent complement to majors in accounting, business analytics and information management, marketing, or sport management. You will learn about financial decision-making for businesses, individuals, and organizations, as well as the role of financial institutions in the economy. This minor will develop your skills in financial analysis, problem-solving, and communication, making you a valuable asset to any organization.
Accredidation: Accredited by AACSB International

Description: The Gender & Sexuality Studies minor provides students with an interdisciplinary understanding of gender and sexuality and their roles in society. Through courses rooted in various disciplines, students will explore topics such as identity formation, social justice, power dynamics, cultural representations, and historical contexts related to gender and sexuality. Students will develop critical thinking, analytical, and communication skills, preparing them for a diverse range of careers and further academic pursuits. This minor complements a wide variety of majors across the University and can be particularly beneficial for students interested in fields such as social work, counseling, education, law, public policy, journalism, health sciences, and the arts.

Department: College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: The minor in Health Sciences provides students with an introduction to the interdisciplinary field of health sciences. This minor gives students an opportunity to explore the various fields within health sciences, including biological, social, and behavioral sciences as they relate to human health. Students completing the minor will gain knowledge and skills relevant to pursuing careers in healthcare, public health, and related fields. This minor is suitable for students from a wide range of majors who have an interest in health and healthcare professions, but do not want to pursue a dedicated health sciences major. The program requirements allow students to tailor the minor to their specific interests within the health sciences field. A minor in Health Sciences complements a wide range of majors. The minor will help prepare you for a variety of health-related careers or further study in public health, occupational therapy, physical therapy, and other allied health professions. In this minor, you will explore diverse areas within the health sciences, including public health, healthcare policy, epidemiology, health disparities, nutrition, and exercise science. You will develop critical thinking skills, research abilities, and an understanding of ethical considerations in healthcare.

Requirements: To declare a minor, students should obtain the appropriate form from the Dean's Office of their College.
Description: A Minor in History provides students with an understanding of historical methods and an appreciation for the social, political, and economic forces that have shaped Western and non-Western societies. Students will learn how to analyze historical evidence, evaluate conflicting interpretations, and construct reasoned arguments.

Requirements: A minor in Human Resources Management is available to any Western New England University student. The process to declare a minor is for students who are already enrolled at the university. Application requirements for general first-year admission include: Common Application or WNE Application, Official high school transcript(s), One letter of recommendation (from a teacher or school counselor), and a Personal Essay/Writing Sample. Western New England University is a Test Optional institution.
Description: A minor in human resources management provides students with a foundational understanding of the principles and practices of managing human capital within an organization. This minor helps students develop skills in recruitment, training and development, performance management, compensation and benefits, and employee relations. It complements various majors, preparing students for roles in HR departments or enhancing their management capabilities in any field.
Accredidation: Accredited by AACSB International, The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business

Description: Today, business is truly global. With a minor in international business, you can broaden your career opportunities and enhance your major in any business discipline. The International Business minor allows students to take courses focusing on specific business aspects as they relate to a global economy. This minor will give you a fundamental understanding of how cultural, political, and economic factors affect business activities in the global marketplace and provide an advantage when entering the job market.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International—the highest standard of achievement for business schools worldwide. Less than five percent of the more than 16,000 schools worldwide granting business degrees have earned AACSB accreditation.

Requirements: Students must complete 21 credits in the following areas with a grade of C- or better in each course and a minimum GPA of 2.0 in the minor.
Description: Open to students from all majors across the University, the minor in International Studies will prepare you to be an engaged citizen of the world. Through the interdisciplinary courses, you will develop a deep understanding of global issues and their interconnectedness. This minor will broaden your perspective, enhance your intercultural communication skills, and equip you with the knowledge and abilities to thrive in an increasingly globalized world. The International Studies minor offers students from across the University the opportunity to delve into a wide array of global topics and cultures. Designed to complement any major, this minor enhances your primary field of study by providing an international perspective. You will gain valuable skills in cross-cultural understanding, critical analysis of global issues, and effective communication across diverse backgrounds. These skills are highly sought after by employers in various fields, including international business, diplomacy, non-profit organizations, and education.

Requirements: A minor in Journalism is open to students in all majors.
Description: Learn to tell compelling stories, dig for the truth, and use your voice to make a difference in the world. As a Journalism minor, you will hone your skills in writing, editing, and reporting across various media platforms. With hands-on experience and real-world projects, you will learn to navigate the ever-evolving media landscape and become a responsible and ethical communicator.
